Definition: You will be given a pair of words. You need to deduce the type of relationship between them. The possible types of relations are: 'HYPER', 'COORD' and 'RANDOM'. The first word will be denoted by X and the second word will be denoted by Y. A COORD relationship is when X and Y belong to the same semantic class. A HYPER relationship is when X is a specific instance of Y. If neither COORD nor HYPER are applicable, then the relationship is RANDOM.

Positive Examples.explanation: Turtle and flow have no relation, so RANDOM is the correct label.
Bowl and game are HYPER because bowling is a game.
Whale and salmon belong to the same semantic class so COORD is the correct relation.

Negative Examples.explanation: The correct relation is RANDOM, as they donot have any relationship, so COORD is incorrect.
Maximum and extreme are HYPER as maximum can be regarded as a specific instance of extreme (since maximum is an extreme), so RANDOM is incorrect.
The true label is COORD as both of them are vehicles, so HYPER is an incorrect label.
